questions.question:
What will be the value of c after the following code executes?

int main() {
    int a = 10;
    int b = --a;
    int c = a-- + b++;
    printf("%d\n", c);
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int x = 10;
    printf("%zu\n", sizeof(x + 1.5));
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following C program?
int main() {
    int a = 1, b = 0, c = -1;
    if (a || b && c)
        printf("True");
    else
        printf("False");
}

What will be the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int i = 3;
    if (--i && i++) {
        --i;
    }
    printf("%d\n", i);
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

enum { A = 1, B, C = 5, D };
int main() {
    printf("%d %d %d %d\n", A, B, C, D);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    char str[] = "Hello";
    printf("%c", ++str[0]);
}

What will be the output of the following code?

int main() {
    char ch = 'm';
    ch = ch - ('a' - 'A');
    printf("%c\n", ch);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    char str[] = "Hello";
    printf("%s", str++);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {
    char *ptr = "Hello";
    printf("%s", ptr++);
}

What will be the output of the following code?
class A {
public:
    virtual void display() { cout << "Class A
"; }
};
class B : public A {
public:
    void display() { cout << "Class B
"; }
};
class C : public B {
public:
    void display() { cout << "Class C
"; }
};
void show(A *obj) {
    obj->display();
}
int main() {
    A *a = new C();
    show(a);
    delete a;
    return 0;
}
Which of the following keywords is used to prevent a class from being inherited?

What is the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
class A {
public:
    A() { cout << "A's constructor
"; }
    ~A() { cout << "A's destructor
"; }
};
class B {
    static A a;
public:
    B() { cout << "B's constructor
"; }
    ~B() { cout << "B's destructor
"; }
};
A B::a;
int main() {
    B b;
    return 0;
}

options.a:
B's constructor 
 A's constructor 
 A's destructor 
 B's destructor
options.b:
A's constructor 
 B's constructor 
 B's destructor 
 A's destructor
options.c:
A's constructor 
 B's constructor 
 A's destructor 
 B's destructor
options.d:
B's constructor 
 A's constructor 
 B's destructor 
 A's destructor

questions.question:
What is the output of the following program?

using namespace std;
int main() {
    int x = 5;
    int *ptr = &x;
    int **ptr_ptr = &ptr;
    cout << **ptr_ptr;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

using namespace std;
void changeValue(int &ref) {
    ref = 10;
}
int main() {
    int x = 5;
    changeValue(x);
    cout << x;
    return 0;
}

Given the following code, what will be the output?

using namespace std;
template 
void func(T arg) {
    cout << "Template: " << arg << endl;
}
template <> 
void func(int arg) {
    cout << "Specialized: " << arg << endl;
}
int main() {
    func(5);
    func(5.5);
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
template 
void print(T arg) {
    cout << "Template: " << arg << endl;
}
void print(int arg) {
    cout << "Non-template: " << arg << endl;
}
int main() {
    print(10);
    print(10.5);
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
void test() {
    static int count = 0;
    count++;
    cout << count << " ";
}
int main() {
    for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
        test();
    }
    return 0;
}
What type of constructor is called when an object is created without parameters?
What does the term 'overfitting' mean in the context of machine learning?

options.a: The model's inability to capture underlying patterns in the data
options.b: The model performing well on unseen data
options.c: The model being too simple to capture the data's complexity
options.d: The model performing well on the training data but poorly on new data

questions.question: What is the primary goal of clustering algorithms?

options.c: To reduce the dimensionality of data

questions.question: Which collision resolution technique in a hash table guarantees O(1) average time complexity for search, insert, and delete operations?
What is the primary purpose of the Adam optimization algorithm commonly used in training neural networks?

options.a: To minimize the number of iterations needed for convergence
options.d: To speed up the training process

questions.question: Which of the following problems can be solved using dynamic programming to find the optimal solution?
What is the average case time complexity of the quicksort algorithm?
Which algorithm is used to find the minimum spanning tree in a connected, undirected graph?
What is the maximum number of leaf nodes in a binary tree of height h?
Which data structure is used to implement a priority queue?
Which algorithm is used to search a sorted array by repeatedly dividing the search interval in half?
In a circular linked list, where does the last node point to?
Which of the following is a characteristic of supervised learning?
Which command is used to change a file's owner?
Which command is used to terminate a running process in Unix/Linux?
Which command is used to display the disk space usage of files and directories in Unix/Linux?
Which command is used to display a calendar in Unix/Linux?
To display the last 10 lines of a file, which command should be used?
In machine learning, what does the term "bias" refer to?

options.a: The error introduced by the model's inability to capture underlying patterns
options.b: The difference between the predicted and actual values
options.c: The tendency of a model to perform well on the training data but poorly on new data
options.d: The variance in the data distribution

questions.question: What is the primary drawback of using the k-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithm?

options.a: It requires a lot of memory
options.b: It is only suitable for binary classification
options.c: It is sensitive to outliers and noise

questions.question: Which software testing technique involves testing a system's behavior at or beyond its limits?
In software testing, 'regression testing' refers to:

options.b: Testing the system in a live environment
options.d: Testing the software in all possible scenarios

questions.question: Which command is used to display the process status in Unix/Linux?
Which component of a CPU performs arithmetic and logic operations?
What does RAID stand for in terms of storage systems?
Which pipeline stage retrieves instructions from memory?
______ is a tool used for managing software requirements.
Which software development approach emphasizes producing a potentially shippable product increment after each iteration?
A processor with a 64-bit data bus uses 16M x 8 DRAM chips. What is the smallest memory this system can have?
Which phase of the software development life cycle involves fixing defects and making improvements to the software?
Which software testing technique focuses on testing the software's response to unexpected inputs or conditions?
Which software development principle emphasizes that software components should have high cohesion and low coupling?
If a 2 GHz processor has a CPI (Cycles Per Instruction) of 1.5, what is the average execution time per instruction?
Which protocol provides reliable, connection-oriented communication for data transfer?
In which layer of the OSI model does data compression occur?
Which protocol is used to convert a domain name into an IP address?
Which device operates at the Data Link layer of the OSI model?
In which OSI model layer does encryption and decryption of data occur?
The maximum length of a CAT5 cable is:
Which software metric measures the number of defects identified in a software system?
Which protocol is used for transferring files over a network?
Which type of network topology has each device connected to exactly two other devices, creating a circular pathway?
Which protocol is used to manage and monitor network devices?
In which scheduling algorithm do processes wait for their turn in a circular queue?
Consider the SQL query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT department) FROM employees; What does it return?

options.b: The number of unique departments in the employees table.
options.c: The number of employees in each department.
options.d: An error due to the use of COUNT with DISTINCT.

questions.question: Which memory management scheme permits the physical address space of a process to be non-contiguous?
When a process is in the "New" state, it is:
Which term describes the phenomenon when a process spends more time paging data in and out of memory than executing?
Which of the following is not a valid state of a process?
Which of the following scheduling algorithms may cause starvation?
Which of the following is used to uniquely identify a process?
Which of the following is a synchronization tool?
In a system with a 16 KB page size, how many bits are required to represent the page offset in a 32-bit virtual address?
In which of the following scheduling algorithms does the process that requires the shortest execution time get executed next?
Which SQL clause is used to sort the result set of a query in ascending or descending order?
Which of the following statements about views is FALSE?

options.b: Views can be updated directly in all cases.
options.c: Views can hide complexity from users.
options.d: Views do not store data physically.

questions.question: The address of a page table in memory is pointed to by ______________.
A process can be terminated due to ______________.
Which SQL command is used to remove a table from the database?
Which normal form deals with transitive dependencies?
Which type of join returns only the rows that have matching values in both tables?
Which SQL command is used to modify existing data in a database table?
Which type of index uses a bit vector for each unique value to improve query performance?
In a network with 5 routers, how many direct connections can be made if each router connects to every other router?
Which of the following are examples of unsupervised learning algorithms?
What is the worst-case time complexity of searching for an element in a balanced binary search tree?
Which of the following are software development methodologies?
Which of the following are characteristics of Agile software development?

options.c: Emphasis on working software over comprehensive documentation

questions.question: In a hash table with 100 slots, if there are 50 elements stored, what is the load factor?
Which of the following are SQL aggregate functions?
Which of the following are true about transactions in a database?

options.a: A transaction is a single logical unit of work.
options.b: ACID properties (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability) ensure transaction reliability.
options.d: Transactions can be rolled back if an error occurs.

questions.question: Given the following SQL statement, how many rows will be affected if the 'salary' field is updated? UPDATE employees SET salary = salary * 1.1 WHERE department = 'HR';

options.a: It will always affect all rows.
options.b: It will affect the rows in the HR department only.
options.c: It cannot be determined without additional information.
options.d: It will affect the rows not in the HR department.

questions.question: Which of the following are protocols used in the Application Layer of the OSI model?
Which of the following are characteristics of UDP (User Datagram Protocol)?

options.b: UDP provides unreliable and unordered delivery of data.
options.d: UDP is often used for real-time applications like video streaming.

questions.question: If a web server handles 200 requests per second and each request takes 0.5 seconds to process, what is the maximum number of concurrent requests it can handle?
Which of the following are process states in an operating system?
Which of the following are methods for handling deadlocks?
Which of the following statements about pipelining in computer architecture are true?

options.b: Each stage in a pipeline completes a part of an instruction.
options.c: Pipelining can lead to hazards such as data hazards, control hazards, and structural hazards.
options.d: Pipelining increases the execution time of individual instructions.

questions.question: Which of the following commands are used to change file permissions in UNIX?
Which of the following are valid ways to redirect output in UNIX?
Which of the following statements about binary trees are true?

options.a: A binary tree can have at most two children per node.
options.b: In a binary search tree, the left child is always smaller than the parent node.
options.c: A full binary tree is a binary tree in which each node has exactly zero or two children.
options.d: A complete binary tree is a binary tree where all levels are fully filled except possibly the last level, and the last level has all keys as left as possible.

questions.question: Which of the following are types of IP addresses used in networking?
Which of the following are true about polymorphism in C++?

options.a: It allows functions to have the same name but different signatures.
options.b: It enables objects to be treated as instances of their parent class.
options.c: It includes both compile-time (static) and run-time (dynamic) polymorphism.
options.d: It is achieved through function overloading and operator overloading only.
